intro: Chimarrhis glabriflora, commonly known as the smooth-flowered chimarrh, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy soils and salty air. Its flowers are often visited by insects and birds, contributing to its ecological importance in its native habitat.
